Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a carinated body, a long splayed nozzle terminating in a rounded tip, and a small oval filling-hole area. The wide shoulder is decorated with tongues. The nozzle-top is decorated in relief with a columnar device. On the left side is a lug. The oval raised base is flat below, and contains a sunken monogram of the letters pi and rho. There are traces of a red-brown slip on the upper side.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q555.ter)
